sentences: Harry Charles Prime  (March 5, 1920 â€“ June 15, 2017) was a Big Band vocalist who performed from the late 1940s through the mid-1950s.
Prime was a featured vocalist with the orchestras of Randy Brooks, Tommy Dorsey, Jack Fina and Ralph Flanagan.
He died in Chalfont, Pennsylvania in 2017 at the age of 97.
Prime recorded nearly 100 songs in the 1940s and 1950s, including "Until," a million-seller with the Tommy Dorsey Orchestra.
"Until" peaked at number four in the US chart.
